Find employment fast with the SONIC Drive-In application. A brand new career or part-time employment opportunity with SONIC may reside only an application form away. Apply online and begin working a SONIC Drive-In career today.
Employment Opportunities at SONIC Drive-IN
The online SONIC application form offers prospective employees multiple exciting employment opportunities in the fast food restaurant industry. Apply online to receive SONIC hiring consideration now. Complete the online SONIC job application to find career opportunities today. SONIC must find part-time employees as well as full-time associates to staff both restaurant jobs and corporate careers.
Whether you seek an entry-level restaurant job or a corporate career with a successful business, SONIC Drive-In may need you to begin work immediately. SONIC must hire entry-level workers and professional associates to staff part-time vacancies and full-time jobs alike. Applicants over the age of 16 may apply online immediately. Fill out the SONIC online job application to find available restaurant industry careers.
Entry-level SONIC workers often start in crew member jobs. Crew member associates assist customers, prepare food, and complete other assigned tasks. Professional SONIC employees often fin managerial and administrative careers. Professional duties vary according to job title, experience, and department. Professional SONIC applicants may need to meet certain education or work history requirements to receive hiring consideration. Apply online to discover more information on SONIC jobs and employment benefits. SONIC employee benefits may vary greatly according to franchise benefits offered.
SONIC must hire several associates to fill part-time jobs and full-time careers in the fast food restaurant industry. If you start the online SONIC Drive-In job application today, you might begin earning the competitive salary and quality job benefits you seek in a new fast food industry career. Apply online to receive immediate SONIC Drive-In employment consideration as well as find more information on available SONIC jobs and employee benefits. Finish the online SONIC Drive-In application form to find career opportunities now.
Available SONIC Drive-In Jobs and Salary Information As a major restaurant company, SONIC Drive-In must hire entry-level workers and professional associates to staff part-time vacancies and full-time jobs in the fast food industry. SONIC needs employees to staff jobs across the U.S. Apply online to find a SONIC locations hiring near you. Complete the online SONIC employment application to find fast food career opportunities. SONIC must fill the following fast food jobs :
Crew Members –SONIC crew members often work as carhops and kitchen workers. Crew members prepare and deliver food quickly and efficiently. SONIC crew members often earn starting pay rates near minimum wage.
Management –Managers with SONIC may apply for restaurant manager, assistant manager, and co-manager jobs. Management job duties include scheduling workers, hiring employees, training associates, and overseeing daily restaurant operations. A SONIC manager typically earns a starting salary between $20,000 and $50,000 per year, according to job title, experience, and location.
SONIC Drive-In may need several additional workers to fill restaurant, maintenance, and corporate jobs. Available SONIC positions include analyst, intern, drive-thru crew member, instructional designer, and engineer positions. Apply online to find a variety of available jobs at SONIC Drive-In fast food restaurants. Fill out a SONIC Drive-In employment application to find more information on available fast food industry jobs.
SONIC Work Benefits Employees of SONIC enjoy several job benefits , such as flexible scheduling, paid training, and industry-competitive pay scales. Eligible SONIC associates may access additional employee benefits. Qualified workers may take advantage of financial planning perks, healthcare bonuses, and additional employment benefits at SONIC.
SONIC workers may enjoy financial planning benefits, such as 401(k) retirement plans. Qualified SONIC employees may access healthcare coverage, including medical, dental, and vision care plans. Additional SONIC benefits may include tuition assistance, employee assistance programs, and paid time off. As a franchised business, SONIC employment benefits may vary greatly by franchise. Apply online to discover more information on available SONIC Drive-In employment benefits as well as the requirements needed to earn job benefits with SONIC.
Read more about SONIC Drive-In benefits .

History SONIC Drive-In traces corporate history to a chain of root beer and hot dog stands known as Top Hat. When the original Top Hat location provided drive-up speaker ordering boxes, business tripled. The original SONIC founders, Troy N. Smith Sr. and Charles Woodrow Pappe, started the first company franchise with a single handshake and no firm franchising requirements. When the two men discovered the name Top Hat already existed as a trademark, the duo changed company names to SONIC. As the company grew, SONIC began offering standardized menus from most locations.
Special Services SONIC Drive-In restaurants offer burgers, coneys, hot dogs, milkshakes, coffee, soft drinks, and several other traditional roadside hamburger stand fare. SONIC offers carside service and still allows customers to order from speaker boxes mounted throughout the SONIC parking lot. Carhops deliver food directly to automobiles and some locations even allow carhops to work on roller skates. Many SONIC Drive-In restaurants also offer drive-thru windows for patrons on the go.
Community Involvement As a large restaurant business with grassroots company history, SONIC understands the importance of giving back to the communities supporting its business. SONIC regularly donates to support local and national charities providing services to improve education and academic opportunity. SONIC works with national charities, like DonorsChoose.org, to sponsor charitable programs, such as the Limeades for Learning national cause.
Environmental With such a large business, SONIC Drive-In strives to keep its corporate carbon footprint in check. SONIC restaurants participate in local recycling and waste management programs. The business also works to ensure welfare for the animals destined to end up as SONIC menu options. SONIC works to ensure every supplier meets or exceeds the government regulated guidelines for animal treatment.
Planned Expansion SONIC Drive-In fast food restaurants operate in most of the fifty states in the U.S. As of April 2011, SONIC announced national expansion plans but no international expansion plans. SONIC operates more than 3,500 restaurants across the U.S. and plans to continue aggressive expansion throughout the nation.
Financial SONIC operates as a public company and trades on the NASDAQ exchange under the stock symbol SONIC. The company, founded in Shawnee, OK, maintains corporate headquarters in Oklahoma City, OK. The restaurant business operates more than 3,500 U.S. locations and employs thousands of restaurant and corporate employees.
